definition: sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: After intense searching I finally found it and put it on.
sentences.chinese: 一顿天翻地覆的寻找之后，我终于找到了一只文胸。

sentences.english: The United squad is very large and there is no major significance in adding another name.
sentences.chinese: 曼联班底已经非常庞大，再增加一人不会天翻地覆。

sentences.english: The violent revolution upturned the whole country.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴力革命使整个国家天翻地覆。

sentences.english: Content abstract The knowledge economy time, the social economy has had the earth-shaking change.
sentences.chinese: 知识经济时代，社会经济发生了天翻地覆的变化。

sentences.english: Today, this piece of land of has long been turned upside down, hustle and bustle.
sentences.chinese: 如今，这片热土早已是天翻地覆，龙腾虎跃。

sentences.english: And he will jostle with a financial system turned upside down.
sentences.chinese: 他还必须与天翻地覆的金融体系进行一番搏斗。

sentences.english: Today digital technology is driving a revolution that’s even more earthshaking.
sentences.chinese: 如今，数码技术正驱动着一场更为天翻地覆的革命。

definition: sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
heaven falls and earth rends (idiom); rocked by a major disaster/fig. violent revolution/major social upheaval
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
(in such circumstances) there will be no peace/one can never breathe easy
to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist/to turn over a new leaf/fig. to change wholly/to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
lit. breeze is still, waves are quiet (idiom); tranquil environment/all is quiet/a dead calm (at sea)
